pages.text: To construct a $(item)Campfire$(), follow these four easy steps:$(p)  $(l:survive/campfire#craft_tinder)1. Craft Tinder$()$(br)  $(l:survive/campfire#place_tinder)2. Place Tinder$()$(br)  $(l:survive/campfire#add_logs)3. Add logs$()$(br)  $(l:survive/campfire#ignite)4. Ignite$()

pages.title: 1. Craft Tinder
pages.text: First, you will need some $(item)Tinder$() - $(italic)a word which here means a dry, flammable material, such as sticks or plant fibers, that is often used to aid in lighting a fire$() - to aid in lighting your fire.

Finally, use any $(l:appendix/ignition)verified fire-starting device$() to ignite.$(p)$(italic)~ Author's Notes:$()$(p)I have used a $(item)Campfire$() very similar to the one illustrated here and it is because of this experience, or rather your inexperience, that I would like to tell you that the experience of cooking on an open flame is a joyous one, but I cannot.

What I can tell you, from the experience of many hungry nights, is that $(info) food left cooking unattended will burn.$(p)I can also tell you that $(info) a shovel is required to remove ash and that $(info) a $(item)Campfire$() can be extinguished by rain or a bucket of water.
